column4: yeah...because my monitor goes into this mode, and it says 60hz on the screen, but in the settings for ubuntu it says 93hz
i'll try it, hope this doesn't break my computer
it's crt, my eyes, the goggles do nothing
it really just looks like it's at 60 hz...because it hurts my head
well...i would just manually edit xorg.conf....but my monitor is so old i can't get the specs on it
nah...google has let me down for the last time
someone had directed me to this, to reconfigure to vidcard as well as other devices, sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
i already have done that misslecommander but thanks
it didnt change anything for you ?
then install ubuntu, then make two extra partitions for ubuntu, one as ext3, and one for swap
there is a URL i can give u that supposedly can fix the issue, but i tried it, and i got a random "out of range" message on reboot
